svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
May 27, 2023" date: "2023-05-27"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes
from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : SELFDESTRUCT removal impact analysis : EIP6780
(SELFDESTRUCT only in same tx) is low impact and will be in Cancun; EIP6913 SETCODE not
in Cancun for now EIP4844 discussions: excess_data_gas, use big endian for precompile,
remove SSZ EIPs, draft devnet 6 spec (last EIP4844 specific devnet before Dencun
devnets) Proposed ordering of Cancun & Prague opcodes being added to execution specs
Final candidates for inclusion in Cancun: EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM), EIP2537
(BLS precompile), EIP5656 (MCOPY), EIP5920 (PAY) & EIP7069 (revamped CALL
instructions); no more EIPs to be considered for Cancun
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes from
Tim Beiko and Christine Kim :
* SELFDESTRUCT removal impact analysis : EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in same tx) is low
impact and will be in Cancun; EIP6913 SETCODE not in Cancun for now
SELFDESTRUCT removal impact analysis : EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in same tx) is low
* EIP4844 discussions: excess_data_gas, use big endian for precompile, remove SSZ EIPs,
draft devnet 6 spec (last EIP4844 specific devnet before Dencun devnets)
EIP4844 discussions: excess_data_gas, use big endian for precompile, remove SSZ EIPs,
* Proposed ordering of Cancun & Prague opcodes being added to execution specs
Proposed ordering of Cancun & Prague opcodes being added to execution specs
* Final candidates for inclusion in Cancun: EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM), EIP2537
* Consensus-specs v1.4.0-alpha.0 : Deneb updates & attnets revamp
Consensus-specs v1.4.0-alpha.0 : Deneb updates & attnets revamp
* KZG ceremony nears 100k contributions, now available to accounts with 16 mainnet
transactions
KZG ceremony nears 100k contributions, now available to accounts with 16 mainnet
Layer 1
* Ben Edgington: deposits & withdrawals , new chapter from Upgrading Ethereum book
Ben Edgington: deposits & withdrawals , new chapter from Upgrading Ethereum book
* Geth team: what happens if a supermajority EL client has a bug ?
Geth team: what happens if a supermajority EL client has a bug ?
* Verkle overlay tree conversion method implemented
Verkle overlay tree conversion method implemented
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v4.2.0 : validator client faster to detect & avoid beacon
nodes with offline execution layer Prysm v4.0.5 : attestation aggregation improvements
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v4.2.0 : validator client faster to detect & avoid beacon nodes with
offline execution layer
Lighthouse v4.2.0 : validator client faster to detect & avoid beacon nodes with offline
execution layer
* Prysm v4.0.5 : attestation aggregation improvements
Prysm v4.0.5 : attestation aggregation improvements
* Execution layer: Geth v1.12.0 : PoW removed, GraphQL numeric values encoded as hex
strings Nethermind v1.18.2 : sync process accelerated
Execution layer:
* Geth v1.12.0 : PoW removed, GraphQL numeric values encoded as hex strings
Geth v1.12.0 : PoW removed, GraphQL numeric values encoded as hex strings
* Nethermind v1.18.2 : sync process accelerated
Nethermind v1.18.2 : sync process accelerated
For Stakers
* Eth-wizard v0.9.7 : validator setup on Ubuntu/Windows with MEV-Boost
Research
* Path to enshrined Proposer-Builder Separation : top-down via Two-Block HeadLock
(variant of two-slot PBS) and bottom-up via optimistic relay
Path to enshrined Proposer-Builder Separation : top-down via Two-Block HeadLock
* Timing games : proposer may delay block proposal to maximize MEV but still be early
enough to be included
Timing games : proposer may delay block proposal to maximize MEV but still be early
Layer 2
* Distributed Sequencer Technology : proposal for progressive decentralization of L2
sequencers using Distributed Validator Technology
Distributed Sequencer Technology : proposal for progressive decentralization of L2
* Layer N zk fraud proofs : hybrid approach only requires a proof to be generated when
there is possibility of fraud
Layer N zk fraud proofs : hybrid approach only requires a proof to be generated when
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP7069 : Revamped CALL instructions
EIPs:
* EIP7069 : Revamped CALL instructions
* ERCs: ERC7050 : NFT creator provenance ERC7053 : Interoperable digital media indexing
ERC7066 : ERC721 lockable
ERCs:
* ERC7050 : NFT creator provenance
ERC7050 : NFT creator provenance
* ERC7053 : Interoperable digital media indexing
ERC7053 : Interoperable digital media indexing
* ERC7066 : ERC721 lockable
Stuff for developers
* OpenZeppelin Contracts v4.9.0 : Governor with Timestamps support for Optimism & Base,
ERC4626 inflation attack protection, default admin rules for AccessControl, improved
EIP712 signature interoperability via EIP-5267 and ERC777 deprecated
OpenZeppelin Contracts v4.9.0 : Governor with Timestamps support for Optimism & Base,
* Solc contract metadata explainer: IPFS hash of JSON metadata + Solidity version
Solc contract metadata explainer: IPFS hash of JSON metadata + Solidity version
* Foundry: Foundry pre v1 update highlights Forge-std v1.5.6 : new cheatcodes and pure
console log tip: console logging supports format specifiers e.g. %s and %d
Foundry:
* Foundry pre v1 update highlights
Foundry pre v1 update highlights
* Forge-std v1.5.6 : new cheatcodes and pure console log
Forge-std v1.5.6 : new cheatcodes and pure console log
* tip: console logging supports format specifiers e.g. %s and %d
tip: console logging supports format specifiers e.g. %s and %d
* abi-to-sol v0.7 : generate embeddable output (e.g. no pragma, no license identifier)
abi-to-sol v0.7 : generate embeddable output (e.g. no pragma, no license identifier)
* Guide to finding precision loss vulnerabilities using fuzz testing
Guide to finding precision loss vulnerabilities using fuzz testing
* Cicada : private on-chain voting using homomorphic time-lock puzzles
Cicada : private on-chain voting using homomorphic time-lock puzzles
* Vyper v0.3.8 : transient storage keyword, ternary operators, raw_revert builtin,
shift operators, configurable send() gas stipend and use PUSH0
Vyper v0.3.8 : transient storage keyword, ternary operators, raw_revert builtin, shift
operators, configurable send() gas stipend and use PUSH0
* Ape v0.6.9 : easier testing via Pytest fixtures, Python v3.11 support and use_network
marker
Ape v0.6.9 : easier testing via Pytest fixtures, Python v3.11 support and use_network
* Uniswap live on Sepolia testnet
Uniswap live on Sepolia testnet
* enstate.rs : simultaneous ENS queries with caching, in Rust
enstate.rs : simultaneous ENS queries with caching, in Rust
* Safer : sign & submit transactions to a Safe multisig using Foundry scripts
Safer : sign & submit transactions to a Safe multisig using Foundry scripts
* Curta CTF Baby it’s me solution
Curta CTF Baby it’s me solution
* Code specification overview : focus on plain english, state machines, diagramming,
interfaces, placeholder tests and optionally formal definitions
Code specification overview : focus on plain english, state machines, diagramming,
* Echidna v2.2.0 : multicore fuzzing & optimized coverage collection, up to 20x faster
fuzzing
Echidna v2.2.0 : multicore fuzzing & optimized coverage collection, up to 20x faster
Security
* Tornado Cash governance captured by attacker using SELFDESTRUCT + CREATE2
Ecosystem
* Vitalik: overloading Ethereum’s social consensus is high-risk , app devs & Layer 2s
need to find alternatives to achieve their security goals, there will be no bailouts
Vitalik: overloading Ethereum’s social consensus is high-risk , app devs & Layer 2s
* Nick Fett: restaking is overhyped
Nick Fett: restaking is overhyped
* Optimism’s RetroPGF round 2 learnings
Optimism’s RetroPGF round 2 learnings
* ETHDam hackathon projects
ETHDam hackathon projects
* ETHGlobal autonomous worlds hackathon finalists
ETHGlobal autonomous worlds hackathon finalists
Notable at app layer
* Maker voting to raise DSR to 3.33%
Maker voting to raise DSR to 3.33%
* Levon : get a credit score for a Maker vault, beta
Levon : get a credit score for a Maker vault, beta
* Kain: state of Synthetix
Kain: state of Synthetix
* TAI (controlled peg stablecoin) live on mainnet
TAI (controlled peg stablecoin) live on mainnet
* Astaria (NFT-backed lending) live on mainnet, beta
Astaria (NFT-backed lending) live on mainnet, beta
* Safe multisig adds ERC1271 message signing support (used for OpenSea signing)
Safe multisig adds ERC1271 message signing support (used for OpenSea signing)
* Utopia : Safe multisig gasless swaps, beta
Utopia : Safe multisig gasless swaps, beta
* Flashbots Bundler : UI for token rescues from compromised addresses
Flashbots Bundler : UI for token rescues from compromised addresses
Job Listings
* Protocol Engineer (DeFi) sought by Tunnel Vision Labs
Protocol Engineer (DeFi) sought by Tunnel Vision Labs
* Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
* Devconnect Istanbul: Production Assistant and Volunteer Coordinator
Devconnect Istanbul: Production Assistant and Volunteer Coordinator
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable to abcoathup.eth.
Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* US Fed : 10% of adults used crypto in 2022
US Fed : 10% of adults used crypto in 2022
* Dan Elitzer: DeFi primitives should have no governance, no upgradeability and no
oracles
Dan Elitzer: DeFi primitives should have no governance, no upgradeability and no
General/crypto
* Taylor warns of targeted spearphishing
Taylor warns of targeted spearphishing
* KeePass vulnerability , master password can be retrieved from memory
KeePass vulnerability , master password can be retrieved from memory
* Poseidon hash Merkle Trees implemented in FPGA hardware
Poseidon hash Merkle Trees implemented in FPGA hardware
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-may-27-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
* Jun 2-7 – ETH Belgrade conference & hackathon
Jun 2-7 – ETH Belgrade conference & hackathon
* Jun 9-11 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
Jun 9-11 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
* Jun 22 –25 – Pragma Waterloo & ETHGlobal Waterloo hackathon
Jun 22 –25 – Pragma Waterloo & ETHGlobal Waterloo hackathon
* Jul 5-9 – ETHBarcelona conference & hackathon
Jul 5-9 – ETHBarcelona conference & hackathon
* Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
* Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
* Aug 15-16 – ETHToronto & ETHWomen
Aug 15-16 – ETHToronto & ETHWomen
* Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
* Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
* Aug 30 – Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
Aug 30 – Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
* Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
* Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
* Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
* Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
* Sep 18-21 – ETH Montréal hackathon & conference
Sep 18-21 – ETH Montréal hackathon & conference
* Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
* Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
* Oct 6-8 – ETHRome hackathon
Oct 6-8 – ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 6–27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
Oct 6–27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Oct 27–29 – ETH Miami festival + hackathon
Oct 27–29 – ETH Miami festival + hackathon
* Nov 3-5 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
Nov 3-5 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
* Nov 3-5 – ETHBrno
Nov 3-5 – ETHBrno
* Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
* Nov 17-19 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
Nov 17-19 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
